title: US names veteran diplomat Mark Lambert as top China policy official
description: The Asia expert, who did two stints at the US embassy in Beijing, will serve as deputy assistant secretary for China and Taiwan, as well as heading the newly created ‘China House’.

title: China’s next multi-nation space mission is set to reveal secrets from the far side of the moon
description: Chang’e 6, the next mission in China’s moon programme, is on schedule for launch in 2024.

title: US trying to counter Chinese overtures to Paraguay, document suggests
description: A report allegedly by US embassy in Asuncion discusses distancing Paraguayan President Santiago Pena from ex-president, who has been sanctioned for corruption.

title: Asian Games a chance for China to break the ice with sports diplomacy
description: Can Beijing mend fences with its neighbours in Northeast Asia as host of the region’s sporting spectacular?

title: Leading Chinese car engineer given provincial leadership role in Hubei
description: The appointment of Shao Xinyu comes as the leadership is seeking to promote more officials with science and technology backgrounds.

title: Chinese President Xi Jinping tells children of fallen policemen to follow ‘heroic fathers’
description: The Chinese leader delivered the message in a letter to eight students who lost a parent in this fashion, urging them to become ‘loyal guards of the party’.

title: China pushes ‘pivot to South and Southeast Asia’ with Yunnan province as gateway to vast market
description: National Development and Reform Commission pledges to support Yunnan with transport, logistics, energy and digital connection with southern neighbours.

title: TikTok sends team to Jakarta in scramble to respond to Indonesia’s ban on social media e-commerce
description: The Chinese short video app has sent a team from Singapore to talk with Indonesian officials about the new law that has taken immediate effect, threatening TikTok’s business model.

title: EU to unveil technologies targeted in China ‘de-risking’ agenda, but plan remains divisive within bloc
description: Brussels to reveal which critical technologies will be at heart of strategy to reduce reliance on China and stop tech flow to Beijing.

title: South China Sea: US-China confrontation looms large
description: Chinese assertiveness towards the Philippines in the disputed South China Sea is risky, as the US has vowed to defend Philippine troops and vessels. More than ever, Washington and Beijing should tread carefully around potential hotspots such as the Second Thomas Shoal, Scarborough Shoal and Taiwan.

title: Tech war: FCC says reinstating ‘net neutrality’ rules could boost agency’s authority to remove Huawei, ZTE equipment from US networks
description: Washington’s efforts to counter Chinese tech giants Huawei and ZTE come amid US fears that Beijing could use their equipment to spy on Americans.

title: Chinese AI-developed drug offers hope to sufferers of obesity and diabetes
description: The new drug MDR-001 could become a disruptor in treatment of obesity and diabetes.

title: China-US ties: Beijing and Washington diplomats overseeing Asian affairs meet in sign of more open communication
description: China’s Vice-Foreign Minister for Asia Sun Weidong meets Daniel Kritenbrink, US Assistant Secretary of State, for ‘candid, in-depth and constructive consultation’ on regional issues, including Taiwan and maritime issues.

title: China explores chip innovation, tennis star’s violent outburst at the Asian Games, dispute over India’s moon landing: SCMP’s 7 highlights
description: From China’s latest chip innovation to South Korean tennis star’s violent outburst at the Asian Games, here are a few highlights from SCMP’s recent reporting.

title: German climate envoy given cold shoulder on trip to Beijing after ‘dictator’ remarks
description: Jennifer Morgan was granted just one meeting with a government official in three days, regarded as a sign of displeasure over Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock’s comments about Xi Jinping.

title: Can China’s high-speed railways get its economy back on track?
description: Investments in railway-related fixed assets increased by 23.4 per cent in the first eight months of 2023, and Beijing hopes the infrastructure boom will help stabilise economic growth.
